C16-3001.title: Compositional Distributional Models of Meaning
C16-3001.author: Mehrnoosh Sadrzadeh, Dimitri Kartsaklis
C16-3001.abstract: Compositional distributional models of meaning (CDMs) provide a function that produces a vectorial representation for a phrase or a sentence by composing the vectors of its words. Being the natural evolution of the traditional and well-studied distributional models at the word level, CDMs are steadily evolving to a popular and active area of NLP. This COLING 2016 tutorial aims at providing a concise introduction to this emerging field, presenting the different classes of CDMs and the various issues related to them in sufficient detail.
